p:
Pairwise F
st values were all effectively zero for the within-stream comparisons along Lunch Creek, and very low at other locations. For example, the F
st between the two Sexton populations (n = 15 and 18), which were separated by only 130 m, was 0.026, and was not statistically significant (p>0.05), meaning there was no population structure within streams. These results justified our approach of combining sampling locales within a few km of each other along the same creek or basin (e.g., for coarse-scale tests of population genetic subdivision).
